item.title: Video leaks of Samsung’s curvier Galaxy S25 Ultra flagship
item.description:
The Samsung Galaxy S25 series is poised to launch in early 2025, but a new leak gives us a good idea of what it will look like. A misleadingly titled “S24 Ultra definitely” video posted to Reddit, determined to be the Galaxy S25 Ultra by reliable leaker Ice Universe, shows off rounded corners not found on Samsung’s current flagship smartphones, backing up previous leaks and rumors.

The rounded corners also echo the rounder UI elements found in the upcoming One UI 7 software update that Samsung will soon be rolling out. Other features seen in the hands-on video include a glossy finish, metallic-looking edges, and Samsung’s recognizable rear camera setup — all of which were also seen in supposed Galaxy S25 Ultra dummy units that leaked...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Jess Weatherbed

item.title: Google to test plain ‘blue link’ results for hotel searches in EU markets in latest DMA twist
item.description:
Google has announced it’s making more changes to how it displays search results in the European Union in response to continued complaints that it’s failing to comply with the bloc’s Digital Markets Act (DMA). This will include what it bills as a “short test” of plain “blue link” style search results for hotel queries in […]

item.title: Intel and Biden Administration finalize $7.86B deal to fund domestic chip manufacturing
item.description:
The U.S. Department of Commerce today confirmed it has awarded $7.865 billion to chip giant Intel under the U.S. CHIPS and Science Act, a federal statute signed into law by President Joe Biden in 2022 to boost domestic semiconductor manufacturing. The figure is notably lower than the potential highest figure announced back in March, when […]

item.title: AI helps India’s Meesho cut customer call costs by 75%
item.description:
Softbank-backed Meesho has rolled out what it claims to be India’s first generative AI-powered voice bot among e-commerce firms for customer support, paring down some expenses by 75%. The Bengaluru-based e-commerce startup, which serves 160 million customers in India, said Tuesday its AI bot currently handles 60,000 customer calls daily in English and Hindi. The […]

item.title: EV charging platform Ampeco raise $26M Series B, as demand for charging soars
item.description:
We last covered EV charging platform Ampeco in 2023 when it raised a Series A round of $13 million. Today it’s raised $26 million in a Series B funding led by Revaia, a growth equity investment fund. That takes its total funding to $42 million.  Many EV charging systems are end-to-end solutions which makes them […]

item.title: Cradle builds out its protein-design AI platform (and wet lab) with $73M in new funding
item.description:
Using AI to accelerate biotech is fast becoming standard practice, and companies offering services to deploy the tech quickly are seeing big uptake and new investment. Cradle is one of these, focused on protein design — and it just raised $73 million to build out its labs and team. Cradle appeared in 2022 as part […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Cambridge materials science spin-out Molyon is on a mission to make next-gen batteries fly
item.description:
Battery tech is pivotal as the world leans into electrification to power decarbonization in the race against climate change. But rising demand is putting more attention on the limits and drawbacks of current generation lithium-ion (Li-ion) battery technology. This is where Cambridge University spin-out Molyon hopes to come in: the U.K. startup is developing next-gen […]

item.title: Huawei launches first phones capable of running its new self-developed operating system
item.description: Huawei launched the Mate 70, Mate 70 Pro and Mate 70 Pro+ and foldable Mate X6 on Tuesday that can run HarmonyOS NEXT, its self-developed operating system.

item.title: Google Sues Ex-Employee For Stealing, Leaking Company Secrets
item.description: Google has filed a lawsuit against a former employee accusing him of stealing confidential company information related to its chip designs and leaking it online.

item.title: Google's Key Argument In Monopoly Lawsuit Falls Flat With US Judge
item.description: A federal judge threw cold water on one of Alphabet Inc.'s key arguments in a Department of Justice lawsuit over allegations that Google monopolized advertising technology.

item.title: Google Proposes Search Result Changes In Europe After Sites Get Low Traffic
item.description: Google has proposed more changes to its search results in Europe after some smaller rivals complained about lower traffic to their sites.

item.title: Elon Musk Hints X Is Making It Harder For People To Read News
item.description: Musk's response seemed to acknowledge Graham's concern, implying that posts with links are indeed deprioritized.

item.title: Rocket Engine Fire Stalls Japan’s Ambitions to Launch Satellites
item.description: Japan is off to a shaky start in its efforts to break into the space rocket market dominated by Elon Musk’s SpaceX.

item.title: iPhone 17 Air rumours: Everything we know so far
item.description: Here's everything we know about Apple's rumoured iPhone 17 Air, a thinner device expected to arrive in 2025.
